  • Registration Certificate;
  • Certificate of Good Standing (if the company is over a year old, and it is available for the extra fee);
  • The Founding Agreement and Corporate charter;
  • Register of Directors;
  • Register of Participants;
  • Apostilled set of company certified documents (one package);
  • Сorporate Seal.

Purchased services for registration (service list can differ due to the particular jurisdiction):

  • Tax for state registration;
  • Registration agent services;
  • Payment for incorporation;
  • Annual service (if you purchase a company with the history, you pay for annual service for all the ownerless years);
  • Courier delivery.

Benefits of the offshore ready-made
company purchasing:

  • Ready-made companies are available immediately after the purchase, a set of documents has been already prepared for sending. However, if you need a notarized and apostilled set of documents, you have to wait 1-2 days for the apostilization.
  • You can go in for commerce immediately after the purchase and account registration.
  • Offshore ready-made company price consists of the company registration cost plus local service cost. This is essentially the same as the regular cost of the company if you use the local service. The cost may differ if the company is several years old, as there were extra annual payments for the company.
  • Our company always suggests you a great quantity of offshore ready-made companies with various names to choose.
  • You can always change the shareholders, authorized capital, articles of association, powers, restrict rights, etc.according to the specific customer's needs.
  • Company service fee is paid upon the company purchase and valid for a year from the date of the company purchase.
  • All companies have a good legal status, even though there have never been any bank accounts for them. That is why they are 100% transparent.

Bank Account

Bank Account
Opening a Bank Account

Acalista assists with opening bank accounts with over 120 banks around the world.
Opening a bank account is an easy task for us.

As the banking systems are becoming more and more strict, Common Reporting Standards are integrated in many countries all around the world and government wants to control the residents financial flows, the requirements for companies and company documents for opening the accounts are also tending to be strict.

For a long period of cooperation, our specialists maintain contacts with employees of many banks around the world. It provides our customers with time- and terms-appropriate banking solutions for their business.

Bank account
categories

Private account of a natural person

Corporate account of a company

It can be difficult to open a bank account with a foreign bank due to many reasons that can affect the lead time and cost of opening the account. These are reasons such as:

  • High-risk activity (payments from natural persons, financial, licensed, Forex, gambling, porn activities and so on);
  • Offshore jurisdiction of the company;
  • Lack of a license for licensed activity;
  • Other reasons.

List of banks:

OPENING A BANK ACCOUNT FOR EUROPEAN COMPANIES
  • Switzerland – (completely remote) a deposit of 10,000 euros, only 1 thousand of which is held as a minimum balance. You would be free to use the remaining sum.
  • Cyprus – (it will be possible to certify at the bank's representative office in Kiev/Moscow/ St. Petersburg or at the embassy/consulate of Cyprus). However, according to the Cyprus legislation, a company must have a real office and the employees on islands territory.
  • Portugal – (personal visit to the bank at the final stage, translation of documents into Portuguese).
  • Turkey – (it is possible to open an account remotely, translate documents into Turkish, there is a requirement for a local representative office and a telephone number – we provide these services optionally).
  • Hungary – (translation of documents into Hungarian, personal visit to a bank in Budapest at the final stage of an account opening).
  • Serbia – (translation of documents into Serbian, personal visit to the bank).
  • Singapore – (personal visit to the bank in Singapore).

If you want to open the bank accounts in other jurisdictions, please contact the Acalista group manager.

Besides the banks, accounts in payment systems are also quite popular. A payment system is a financial entity that operates under a bank license. Such a payment system, just like banks, has the ability to issue the unique IBAN numbers, as well as make SWIFT payments. The payment systems, the same way as the banks, provide insurance for their clients' funds. That is, the payment system can be termed as a kind of bank analogue.

Advantages:

  • short timelines of opening an account (up to 2 weeks)
  • lower rates, compared to the banks.

Our company is experienced
in meeting all the requirements of banking institutions for opening an account.

Payment system

Payment system
Opening an Account in Payment Systems

Currently, banks are reluctant to cooperate with companies and non-resident citizens who permanently live abroad and do not have citizenship of the country where they applied to the bank. It is a difficult and time-consuming task to make a deal with such a bank and open an account.

That is why another service that allows you to avoid opening a bank account has appeared on the market. The payment system is a key part of the modern monetary system, that provides remittance between natural and legal persons.

Acalista cooperates with more than 30 payment systems all over the world.

What is
Payment system

Payment systemis a company that provides money exchange under the economic circumstances and across national borders between participants (natural and legal persons). It is the basis of laws, regulations, instruments, systems, procedures and agreements that control payments.

Remarkably, the payment system is not a bank, but an organization that provides financial services with an appropriate license.

The payments can be classified due to large and retail cost based on the payment value and the type of the person that makes the transaction.

Large payments usually are high value payments made by financial institutions. Retail payments are made by natural persons and have relatively low value.

Benefits
of opening an account in a payment system

  • easier customer identification;
  • providing with multi-currency accounts;
  • более more favorable rates for maintenance and transactions;
  • depending on the system,it takes several hours or days to open an account;
  • round-the-clock payment acceptance;
  • providing with VISA, MASTERCARD and others;
  • providing withuniversal, personal or salary cards (relevant for international companies that pay salaries for employees from different countries)
  • opening merchant accounts.

It is not difficult to open a payment account
if you contact our employees. We will answer all your questions.

Merchant Account
How to Add Payments from Sites

If you do an online business, you definitely need a merchant account, or rather several of them. The merchant account allows customers to make purchases from your website using bank cards. It greatly simplifies the purchases for the customer, and increases sales for the company.

ACALISTA offers to open a merchant account in more than 30 banking institutions, as well as in 23 non-bank financial institutions all over the world. The type of the merchant account depends on the type of your company's bussiness, as well as the countries and banking institutions from which you want to receive payments.

Merchant Account Types

Depending on the kind of bussiness and chargebacks level, there are two types of merchant accounts:

high risk – high risk of chargebacks

low risk – low risk of chargebacks

Opening a merchant account forhigh risk activity takes more time and requires necessary documents and information.

The higher the risk of your business, the higher the bank/processing fee on payments.

Riskiness is assessed for each case after careful analysis of:

  • company documents;
  • company website;
  • type of company’s activity;
  • availability of a company bank account;
  • processing history, if any.

offers a merchant account opening in more than 30 banking institutions, as well as in 23 non-bank financial institutions all over the world.

Anguilla is a British territory in the Caribbean, one of the northernmost islands of the Lesser Antilles. It consists of the main island — Anguilla, approximately 26 km long and 5 km wide at its widest point, with a number of smaller islands and reefs with no permanent population. The total land area of the territory is 102 sq km, with a population of about 13,500 (2006 estimate). Offshore companies based in Anguilla are becoming more popular both for their high level of confidentiality and their speed of registration.

We will realize company registration in Anguilla, after reciving KYC documents of clients (copy of passport and confirmation of the address issued within the last 3 months), description of the estimated business activity, and verification by our legal department.

The Anguilla IBC shouldn't conduct business with Anguilla residents, be the owner real estate in Anguilla, or operate in banking or trust and insurance companies (without an appropriate license).

A name for registrations of an offshore company in Anguilla must end with a word, phrase or abbreviation that indicates limited liability, for example «Limited», «ООО», «Société Anonyme», «SA», «Corporation», or Inc.

Prohibited names include those that implie identification of the Royal Family or the British government, such as "National", "Royal", "Republic", "Kingdom", "Commonwealth", "Government", или "Anguilla".

BVI Business Company (BC) is one of the most recognized and oldest offshore financial centers. A new version of the British Virgin Islands International Business Companies Act 2005 eliminated two concept structures of companies that operated within the BVI and an offshore companies that allowed only one type of company: the BVI Business Company.

  • There is no minimum share capital requirement
  • The minimum number of company directors is confined to one (a non-resident and corporate director are allowed)
  • Information about the Director / Shareholder is not publicly available and is kept only by the registered agent
  • There is no requirement to submit the financial statements or accounts auditing
  • Ready-made companies in the BVI are already available. Ask for variants right now.
  • BVI Business Company is good choise for:
  • trading activity
  • foreign companies shares owners

The new unified BVI offshore company is still obtaining tax-free status, including relief from:

  • all and any income tax
  • dividend,
  • percentage,
  • rental charge,
  • royalty,
  • capital gains from the sale of company shares.

BVI offshore company is considered as a tax resident of the BVI. The BVI have signed the agreements on avoidance of double taxation with Switzerland and Japan.

Instead of a tax, there is a fixed annual state duty.

Pros of a Dominica
offshore

The first advantage of a Dominica offshore is the period of company registration. The decision on the application is made in just 1-2 days, so you don't have to wait long for a response or an offshore documentation. Moreover, there is no taxation on the territory of this state, so that you will be able to save on taxes. In adition, there are many others benefits:

  • mimimum costs to the registration of legal person and its administrative services;
  • duty payment does not depend on the amount of the authorized capital;
  • total confidentiality;
  • no need for a mandatory audit;
  • official permission to use the local service.

The list of the company ownership forms that can be registered in Dominica is quite wide, but the most common is the International Business Company (IBC).

Paying taxes features
in Dominica About country

Foreign organizations do not have to pay taxes on the territory of Dominica. However, you will certainly need to transfer the annually duty. The payment is made every year, but no later than the day of registration of a legal entity. If you do not follow this requirement within this time, the company will be expelled from the Register. However, the cost of the duty in Dominica is only $ 100, therefore, the payment will not cost the Earth for the company owner.

If you haven't paid duty in time, you can quickly and easily return the company to the Register. It is enough just to pay off the debt in duty and fines. Nevertheless, the name of the organization will have to be changed anyway. If you need to use a specific name, you can make re-registration of a legal entity with the same name.

Dominica is a state located in the Caribbean and covers only 800 square kilometers. Don't confuse this country with the Dominican Republic. These are completely different states, with different legislation and tax policies. Dominica has not reached the same level of fame as Cyprus or Panama yet, but this offshore zone is also developing very quickly.

Our specialists will help you with quick and qualitative registration of a company in Dominica. At the same time, you can acquire a Ready-made company in Dominica. Feel free to contact us and we will help you to cope with these tasks.

Registration of a company in Nauru

Registration of a company in Nauru

Nauru is one of the smallest republics in the world. The country is situated on a small island in the Pacific Ocean, near the Marshall Islands. Considering an area of 21.3 km2 and a population of slightly more than 10 thousand, there is simply no need for a capital.

Despite these factors, the Republic of Nauru is an excellent place for the offshore companies establishing.

Stages of the jurisdiction
formation

For a long time Nauru was under the authority of the United Kingdom and Germany. It was changed in 1914. Australia had annexed the island, after that it became its part until 1984. After Nauru gained its independence, the country began to develop individualy.

Because of the long period of English members government, a lot of the legislative acts are based on British law. The choice was made towards a parliamentary republic as a political mode, the president led the country. An important body of power in the country is The Supreme Court, that has the wide legal capacity.

Australia has also left its mark on the development of this small country. The main currency in Nauru is the Australian dollar.

Forms of doing business
in NauruBasic features of the offshore companies registration
in NauruTaxation and accounting
in NauruIBC registration services
in Nauru

The state has become an offshore zone due to the terrible economic situation, cased by the depletion of the main resource – phosphates. The legal base was formed earlier.

Offshore relations are regulated by legislation from 1992. The International Business Companies Act is the basis of the country's jurisdiction. At the same time, all conditions have been established for the formation and development of international corporations.

There is the requirement of registration in the form of International Business Companies (IBC) in order to establish an offshore company within the jurisdiction. The establishment of a holding or a commercial corporation can take up to two days because the system is very flexible.

The government has developed the most favorable conditions for offshore companies, however, any kind of fraud can be punished. If the company is suspected of this, it can be easily liquidated.

Thanks to that, the country received recognition as an offshore zone. The jurisdiction allows the anonymous registration. Consequently, the founder can keep a low profile, entrusting the leadership to the formed staff.

The regulation of corporate relationships is also envisaged. They are guided by the following acts:

  • The Corporations Act (1972);
  • The Insurance Companies Act (1974);
  • The Bunking Act (1975).

At the same time, there has been formed the authority that controls the implementation of the interaction norms prescribed in the legislation. The government has formed a group of 10 agents who control the activities of the corporations. As their powers are intertwined, agents often compete with each other.

Some factors should also be attributed to features.

  • 1. The IBC's area of interest can include any activity that is not prohibited by law. However, certain areas require a license permition. These are banking, trust, insurance and reinsurance.
  • 2. You can get a list of offshore registration in Nauru within two weekdays. In this case, the countdown begins from the moment the package of documents is submitted.
  • 3. The name of the company can be registered in any language, but there must be an English translation. The originality of the name is also important.
  • 4. A legal address in the jurisdiction is required for the IBC registration. This is a necessary requirement for receiving correspondence from the Nauru government agencies.
  • 5. Both legal entities and individuals can be offshore managing director.You can choose residents from any country in the world. The same rules are for the shareholders.
  • 6. Foundation documents can be kept anywhere in the world.
  • 7. The confidentiality of information about managers and shareholders is guaranteed in the jurisdiction. This information can only be accessed by a local court decision.
  • 8. There are no restrictions on the choice of banks and number of it. Confidentiality is ensured during transactions.

The legislation allows offshore companies to issue their own registered shares, bearer shares. They can include par value or exist without it. The founder or the meeting of shareholders choose the currency for shares.

You should also pay attention to certain restrictions in the selected offshore zone. The offshore companies in Nauru are prohibited from doing business with residents of the country. There is forbidding on owning of the real estate in the country. The IBC does not have the permission to participate in the offshore management.

Services for resident institutions, that include the registered agent aid for international business companies have been prohibited. The jurisdiction forbits involvement of the resident companies to management or administration.

The government provides a fairly loyal taxation system. The offshore companies are exempt from taxes such as:

  • income tax;
  • capital gains tax;
  • distributed income tax.

Therefore, the international corporation completely gets rid of double taxation.

As for financials, there is also freedom of action. Companies don't commit to lead or provide accounting or other types of reports.

Features of the taxation and reporting
in GuernseyAbout country

Registration of a company in Niue

REGISTRATION OF A COMPANY IN NIUE

Niue is a self-governing state in free association with New Zealand. It is an island country in the South Pacific Ocean. The form of government is a monarchy, the monarch of Great Britain is its formally head. In the early 20th century, the island became a British protectorate.

However, this governance lasted for about a year, since Niue was annexed by New Zealand in 1901. The country became a self-governed state within the Cook Islands in 1974. The official languages are Polynesian and English. The main currency is NZD – New Zealand dollar. American and Australian dollars are using as well.

Peculiarities of the jurisdiction
in Niue

The legal sphere is based on the Anglo-Saxon law. The state of Niue has enacted a number of laws that govern the offshore companies activities, relationships and operations within the jurisdiction.

The Offshore Financial Center is the authority supervising the implementation of the prescribed norms. Among the offshore financial institutions that can be established in Niue are:

  • International Business Companies (IBC);
  • Trusts;
  • Partnership;
  • Sole Trader;
  • Special/Common/Limited Liability Company.

An investor will be able to receive a tax break if only the rules are met, in which he:

  • acquires a license for insurance and banking activities;
  • commits to sell goods and provide services only to the non-residents;
  • will not buy real estate in the country, just rent.

Within this jurisdiction, companies that were registered in other offshore zones as IBCs, continue their activities. They works under the same conditions and have similar financial benefits.

The legislative base for international corporations consists of:

  • The International Business Companies Act, 1994;
  • The Offshore Insurance Act, 1994.

There is an opportunity to conduct any business that is not prohibited by the legislation. The special license is necessary for providing the banking, insurance, trust, reinsurance services. The license is valid for one year, eventually it must be renewal.

Prohibited activities include the commerce with residents. Also, ownership of real estate within the state is not allowed. It is forbidden to involve resident-type companies in management. Providing of registration agent services to resident corporations is also barred.

Relating to the taxation, the main IBC Act 1994, Section 111 exempts the companies from the taxes. IBC do not pay an income tax, a capital gains tax, distributed income tax.

Registration of a company
in NiueOffshore registration services
in Niue

You just need to gather the set of required documents and submit them for committee consideration. It is legally allowed to buy the ready-made companies.

There are the main rules for the IBC:

  • 1. The name of company must be individual and unique. It must contain one of these words: Societe Anonyme, Limited, Corporation and others.
  • 2. The main documents are The Founding Agreement and The Articles of Association.
  • 3. The authorized capital of the offshore company is not limited,
  • 4. There is no currency control of the operations.
  • 5. Foundation documents of IBC and other their types can be kept anywhere in the world.
  • 6. Individuals or legal entities who are residents of any country can be a director. Minimum number of directors — 1.
  • 7. A company has the right to choose the bank for an off-shore account opening. The bank may situated in any country. A number of accounts are not limited for IBC.
  • 8. There must be a registered office and a registration agent within the jurisdiction.
  • 9. There is a possibility of to issue their own registered shares, bearer shares. They can include par value or exist without it.
  • 10. The local service is authorized. Shareholders have the right to own trust shares.
  • 11. The offshore company must not do and submit accounting reports. There is no audit there.

It is mandatory to have a local registration agent for international companies in Niue. A director (legal entity) should definitely exist with a view to managing. The secretary or other employees are hired at the founder's or shareholders' request.

in the BahamasAbout country

  • Share Certificates
  • Apostilled Resolutions of the Subscribers

Malta has been a member of the EU since 2004. Thereafter, Malta is being on a course to become the center of the European business community. Its competitive tax treatment provides the lowest effective corporate tax rate in the European Union.

In addition to tax incentives, investors appreciate English as the official language, the convenience of the EUR zone, professional accounting, and a corporate environment.

A Maltese VAT company operates for the general trading purposes due to its unique tax treatment. If dividends are paid from a trading company to its non-resident shareholder, the shareholder is entitled to claim a refund at the tax rate of 35% paid by the company. 6/7ths of the tax amount is returned to the non-resident shareholder. As a result, the overall rate is reduced to 5%.

The refunds are guaranteed and paid to shareholders by the Internal Revenue Department in 14 days after the application is submitted.

  • The paid income tax refund (6/7ths of the tax amount with the rate of 35%) reduces the effective tax rate to less than 5%.
  • The tax residency certificates will be provided if the management and control is carried out in Malta.
  • Registration of the VAT-number in the EU takes about 2 weeks.
  • Malta is a member of the EU.

Dividend income is completely exempt from the tax if the Maltese company owns at least 10% of the foreign companies shares, or invests in a subsidiary company over 1.5 million EUR for more than 183 days.

A foreign subsidiary company must conform to one the following rules:

to be registered in the EU,
OR
to pay more than 15% corporate tax in any country,
OR
50% or more of its income comes from trading

CORPORATE INCOME TAX (CIT): Resident companies are taxed at the rate of 35% for the worldwide income tax. The amount of tax refund (up to 100%) depends on the company's structure.

INBOUND DIVIDENDS: 0%, if an exemption is applied.

Capital Gains Tax (CGT): 0%, if an exemption is applied.

Peculiarities of the company registration
in Barbados

Barbados legislation offers company registration in three forms of ownership.

The most common type is the limited liability company.

You can also choose a mutual assurance association, no-share capital company.

The last one is available for the businesses that do charity work.

For the registration of the company in Barbados you need to approve the company charter and provide the following documents:

  • declaration in the prescribed form;
  • Memorandum of Association;
  • registration address;
  • information about the Directors;

Furthermore, the transmission of a company's office to another organizations is not allowed. In other words, if you have registered a company in Barbados, you can conduct business anywhere, but not on the islands territory.

Barbados guarantees total confidentiality of the shareholders. According to the current legislation, there should be at least one shareholder in the company (no matter − natural or legal person).

Current and no valid taxes
in Barbados.About country

Current taxes include income taxes (tax legislation provides for a 20% rate), as well as VAT.

Moreover, there will be a need to pay the land taxes and sold property taxes. If the total sales amount exceeds 125,000 of local currency units, the rate will be 2.5%.

As for the no valid taxes, there is no need to pay the capital gains taxes.

Also, you do not have to pay taxes if you receive property by inheritance, or accept as a gift.

The companies registered in Barbados should definitely conduct a tax accounting and report for the inspection authorities.

By the way, if the total income does not reach $500 000, the company is not obliged to conduct annual audits.

Barbados is a small island with a total area of 450 square kilometers only, located in the eastern part of the Lesser Antilles.

Like many other territories in the area, Barbados is under British jurisdiction and has a constitutional-monarchical state system.

De-jure the British Queen is the head of state, but de-facto the local authority belongs to the Governor-General of the island.

This country is known not only as a resort, but also as one of the largest offshore zones with a minimum of taxes for foreign companies.

Taxation of a company in Hong Kong is based on the source, not on the place of company registration. As long as the Hong Kong company does not conduct a business in Hong Kong, and does not get any income from sources in Hong Kong, the company will not have to pay the Hong Kong corporate tax.

Hong Kong is an autonomous territory on China's southern coast of the Pearl River and the South China Sea. It has an area of 1104 square kilometers. In the north, Hong Kong borders on the Special Economic Zone — Shenzhen in the Chinese province of Guangdong.

Hong Kong's population is about 7,2 million people. Hong Kong is one of the most densely populated cities in the world.

Hong Kong had been governed by British jurisdiction until 1997. However, as a result of negotiations between China and the UK, Hong Kong was transferred to the People's Republic of China. That helps Hong Kong to become a special administrative region of China with a high degree of autonomy according to the principle: one country, two systems.

The territory has turned to a major world trade and financial center. Being on the 45th stage in the World Economy Ranking, Hong Kong takes top 10 in GDP per capita.

Registration of a company in Labuan

Registration of a company in Labuan

A new step in business development could be the creation of a company in another country, such as Labuan. It will reduce the tax burden on the business owner and allow him to conduct business all around the world. Labuan, the financial center of Malaysia, is one of the suitable places for registering and starting a company.

Currently, it is recognized as the lowest tax jurisdiction country that does not draw much attention from the lead-countries. It has had this status since 1990 due to its advantageous territorial location between the Philippines, Malaysia and Brunei.

Whereas the registration process has a lot of pecularities, it is better to deal with the skilled experts in order to comply with all standarts and norms.

The Acalista Group specialists have sufficient knowledge and skills of successful providing services for the remote offshore companies registration. Also we offer a list of related services for our clients, including the highly qualified lawyers, accountants and attorneys services.

Advantages and taxation
of an offshore in Labuan

If a trading company wants to be registered on the Labuan exchange, this organization can choose the tax plan that suits it best. Two variants are possible:

  • 1. To pay 3% of the net income after mandatory audit.
  • 2. To pay a fee equal to $ 5,000 every year. In this way, the appointment of an auditor and reporting are not required.

By the way, the companies, aren't leading trading activity, will not be taxed at all, that reduce the tax burden on such enterprises.

One of the advantages of company registration in Labuan is a lack of currency control and a number of taxes.

Futhermore, the local service and the confidentiality of information about the company owner and his banking operations are the pros of this federal jurisdiction. Moreover, the state provides opening a bank account.

Almost all individuals and legal entities are provided with tax incentives. Certain types of income are exempt from tax, regardless of who owns it (a resident of another state or the representative of a country a company is registrated in)

Principal particulars of the company registration
вin Labuan

The offshore jurisdiction of Labuan is gaining popularity not just because of its advantageous geographical location, but also due to the most extensive list of treaties that exclude double taxation.

At the moment, more than 60 banking institutions are registered in the state, as well as many insurance, leasing, trust firms. Bahasa (Malaysia) is the official language on the islands, but English is also widely spoken.

The currency of Labuan is the ringgit, but it is not allowed to make a deal in the local currency for the offshore companies in most cases.

State legislation provides an opportunity to register enterprises of various forms of organization with diverse degrees of responsibility. These two types of companies are the most profitable for the foreign investor:

  • closed-type;
  • open-type.

Closed-type companies are characterized by minimum permissible capital of 2 ringgits and maximum number of 50 shareholders. They are allowed to transfer shares to a third party (or several parties) in free form, as well as to issue credit funds to the directors or other firms.

Moreover, organizations of this type are exempt from handing down the balance sheet of theirs activities in Malaysia.

Open-type companies can also be registered on the state exchange and allow shareholders to transfer shares to third parties.

However, the distinctive features of the open-type companies are an unlimited number of shareholders and the minimum capital amount of 20 million ringgit, which must be paid in full by the time the company is registered. Such organizations are required to have auditors for reporting to the recorder authority in Malaysia.

All types of companies registered in Labuan must have a package of documents, consisting of:

  • Memorandum of Association;
  • Articles of Association;
  • Statutory Declaration of Compliance;
  • Duty payment confirmation;
  • Protocol for Appointment of Director.

Registration will take 2 weeks. You can also purchase an already registered company that can engage in any type of activity that is not prohibited by law.

Formation of the jurisdiction
in the Marshall Islands

Before a separate state appeared on the islands, there had been a long colonial period. The Marshall Islands were ruled by Spain, Germany, Japan. Then power passed to the United States and lasted between 1945 and 1986. After that the islands became independent.

The island of Majuro was declared the capital, and the republican system of government came into force. There are two official languages in the country – Marshallese language and English. The official currency is the US dollar (USD).

Drafting legislation was carried out mostly by American lawyers. The state act Association Law of the Republic of Marshall Islands was created by them. This act is still guiding the process of the companies registration. Due to this legislation, the offshore companies are provided with many advantages, such as:

  • no currency control;
  • the confidentiality is provided by the government;
  • the stability of the State;
  • no need to provide the financial reports;
  • the main currency is the US dollar;
  • a company registration is carried out in the same way as English one;
  • using of the Bearer shares is permitted;
  • the most favorable tax conditions for doing business.

Futhermore, there are the auxiliary legislative acts that regulate the offshore companies operation.

For example, The Business Corporations Act regulates the establishment of a company with an international business. The organization is defined as a company for making an income in the operating process outside the Marshall Islands.

These organizations are not allowed to carry out trust activities, conduct banking operations, provide insurance services. Therefore, there are all the necessary conditions for the offshore companies development in this republic.

The typical offshore form is an ordinary international business company. In this case, we use the type of corporation, that is essential for international business activities and investments – the International Business company (IBC).

Law of Associations merged several acts that regulate the partnership and the system for the IBC operation, among them are:

  • The Coordination Act (1990);
  • The Corporations Legislation Act (1990);
  • The Limited Liability Company Act (1996).

There is only one possible type of the IBC – a local non-resident company, that is easy to set up and manage. The administration system is greately simplified because of the fact that the certain legal provisions are taken from the English system.

Therefore, it is possible to hire an executive manager and a secretary. You can run a company locally or remotely from another country. All data on company operation should be kept in the main office, that can be located anywhere in the world.

At the same time, there is no need to prepare annual or other types of reports. Also, there is no taxation at all, that greatly simplifies the company activities.

The Marshall Islands is a republic located in the Pacific Ocean and belongs to the Micronesia region. The islands are considered as hard-to-reach due to theirs location. However, the colorful countryside, exotic views attract a lot of people.

There are incredibly beautiful beaches, a fascinating underwater world on this island. By the way, the local people are friendly towards tourists and expatriates.

The legislation adopted in 1990 by the Association of the Marshall Islands applies here with the offshore jurisdiction percularities.

Subject to the implementation of the traditional law provisions , the IBC can be established in 1 day. However, it is necessary to comply with the terms that were prescribed for the name creation. This requirement is mandatory and prohibits using some words in a name as trust, bank, charity, insurance.

Moreover, it is compulsory to mention such words as Public Limited Company, Ltd, LLC, Inc, A.G., Limited or S.A.

The registration implies passing some stages.

  • 1. Control and confirmation of the company name in the register.
  • 2. Preparation and completion of the documents.
  • 3. Payment of the duties and fees, required for the registration.
  • 4. Corporation entering into the Register of Companies.
  • 5. Notarization of the documents.

After all stages are complete, the client recieves the completed documents for the created corporation and can start its development.

Registration of a company in Singapore

Registration of a company in Singapore

Today Singapore provides the widest opportunities for the holding entity establishment. Also, this state is an ideal choise for conducting an international trade business.

The Singapore taxation is characterized by a territorial principle with the one difference from other jurisdictions — the external sources income must be kept out of the Singapore boarders. Among the main advantages are:

  • a well-established system of legislation based on the common law;
  • Singapore has the most stable policy in Southeast Asia;
  • registration process takes 1 weekday only;
  • no currency control;
  • the highest positions in the world rankings as a place of doing business;
  • zero rate on the first seventy seven thousand US dollars of income during the first three years of activities;
  • convenient migration legislation that allows you to work and control business activities in Singapore.
Procedure – registration
of a company in Singapore

If you decide to registrate a company in Singapore, it will be completely remote. Registration process takes 1-2 weekdays only. This operation consist of two main stages.

At the beginning, the type of a company and its name should be approved. If you choose a company name, we would advise to avoid the names that are consonant with existing ones, that are similar to already registered trademarks, as well as dissonant names.

The approved name can be booked for sixty days, with the option to renew the booking for another sixty days.

If the name is approved and the founder documentation is prepared, the registration process will be completed within a few hours. But there can be an exceptions.

The State fee should be paid for registration.

An offshore company documentation
in SingaporeRequirements
to an offshore company in SingaporeTaxation system
of an offshore company in Singapore
  • types of business;
  • names;
  • information about shareholdrs and directors;
  • way of doing business;

The most common and popular type of organization in Singapore is the private limited liability company.

The main requirements are the following:

  • There must be at least one shareholder for registration: an individual or legal entity (a resident or non-resident of Singapore);
  • the number of shareholders in a limited liability company cannot be more than fifty people;
  • at least one director – an individual who is a resident of Singapore (a person with citizenship, residence permit or work permit);
  • additionally – unlimited number of the regional or non-resident directors;
  • requirement for shareholders – over eighteen years old, no bankruptcies, no criminal record;
  • one individual can be both a director and a shareholder;
  • information about shareholders and directors is public;
  • The secretary must be a natural person and a resident in Singapore. The Financial Institutions Act requires a secretary to be assigned within six months of the company's registration.

A minimal capital amount is one Singapore dollar. There is no unregistered authorized capital in the Singapore legislation, a paid-in capital only. The bearer shares are prohibited.

The company must have an office, registered in Singapore, since there are prescriptions for being present at the workplace for at least three hours once a week.

Memorandum and Articles of Association should be filed to the Singapore Register of organizations. The Articles of Association defines the type of company activities, and the Memorandum of Association — the relationships within the company. The registration number of the organization must be indicated on the invoices, letters and any other official documents that is on behalf of the company.

The organization must appoint auditors within three months of the company establishment, unless the organization is not required to be audited (if one of the shareholders is an individual and/or if the company's turnover for the year does not exceed five million Singapore dollars).

There is a regulation for the necessity of an annual shareholders meeting, wherein, the first session should be held within eighteen months from the date of the company establishment. Thereafter, the term between meetings cannot be more than fifteen months.

The financial reporting, submitted at the annual meeting, must be completed no later than six months before the date of the meeting.

The organization submits an annual report of the company current structure to the the Singapore Register of companies, with audited (if audit is required) or unaudited accounts within the following month after the Annual General Meeting was called.

Based on the primary documentation, the company prepares financial report, according to the international standards that are valid in Singapore.

The Singapore Organization agrees to conduct an audit in the specified cases. The audit must be carried out by a licensed auditor. The organization undertakes to declare the amount of income and the calculation of taxable profit by filing the appropriate declaration within three months after the end of the fiscal year.

The declaration must be submitted even if a company had no income. All accounting and other records, concerning the company establishment, must be kept for five years.

The director agrees to indicate all types of income, received by the organization activities, in the company financial statements.

Information about any changes in the organization structure must be prompty submitted to the Singapore Register of Companies, otherwise the organization will be fined to the large penalties.

The fundamental principle of taxation is the territorial principle. Income tax is imposed on an organization's income from sources located in Singapore, or a foreign income, received in a bank account, opened in Singapore.

At the same time, dividends, income from the dealership and profits from services that are received outside the state, will be exempt from taxation if taxes on these incomes have been paid at a rate of at least fifteen percent in the country of origin.

Futhermore, there is no capital gains tax in Singapore. The tax resident status will directly depend on the place where the organization is controlled and managed.

Residents and non-residents taxation are the same, with the exception of the residents right of avoiding a double taxation according to the agreements, and exemption from taxes on income, received from the foreign sources; participation in a tax exemption program for a part of income received in the first three years of the organization's activity.

The standard income tax rate is seventeen percent. Resident individuals whose income is up to one hundred thousand Singapore dollars per year (during the first three years of business) are exempted from paying income tax.

For taxpayers whose income does not exceed two hundred thousand Singapore dollars per year, the rate of income is eight and a half percent. Nevertheless, the organization must have no more than twenty shareholders, ten percent of which are individuals.

The organization undertakes to submit the income tax returns with the waybill documentation by December 1 of each following the fiscal year.

Moreover, all products and services provided in Singapore are subject to The Goods and Services Tax at a rate of seven percent.

An organization must be registered as The Goods and Services Tax payer if its annual income has exceeded or is expected to exceed 1 million Singapore dollars.

Taxation and accounting
of a company in Jersey

All tax transfers have been replaced by a license fee, that has a flat rate.

The whole income, received on the Jersey territory, are declared at a 30% rate. Profits, made outside the island, are taxed at a rate of 0.5% to 2%.

Offshore companies are required to keep accounting and provide an annual accounting reports, despite the fact that there is no compulsory financial audit in the island.

Characteristics:

Registration of a company in Monaco

Registration of a company in Monaco

The Principality of Monaco is a unique European state located between two countries – Italy and France. The French riviera is often associated with it, since the Principality is located on the coast of the Ligurian Gulf. This is a country of the resorts and casinos, that helps to increace a large concentration of investments.

As a low-tax jurisdiction, Monaco attracts lots of businessmen because all customer information is kept in highly confidence. Futhermore, there are created the most appropriate environment for an international company establishment.

Peculiarities of the Monaco
jurisdiction

The Principality is an attractive offshore destination in terms of jurisdiction and taxation. However, it cannot be called a typical offshore zone. It is necessary to appeal to the government and get a permission. Otherwise, the company registration is impossible.

Company registration approval can be obtained through the Direction de l’Expansion Economique. The minimum capital for an establishment is 150,000 euros. However, there is no real estate or inheritance taxex and income tax.

Another important feature is the level of confidentiality, that is considered as the most unique in the European space.

The legislation for the companies includes a set of Acts of the Monagesque Commercial Code, that consist of:

  • The Trust Indenture Act №214 of February 27, 1936;
  • The Basic Law №56 of January 29, 1922;
  • The French Banking Act 1984 of January 24, 1984.

According to the Monaco jurisdiction, the foreign businessmen can set up their business here. However, there is a requirement of the company office opening. That is why, you need to rent or purchase premises.

Be aware, the real estate prices are incredibly high here. It is impossible to acquire a shelf company in Monaco. A ready-made company can only be bought from the previous owner, but even in this case, it is necessary to get the consent of the Monaco Government to approve the new owner.

There are several types of companies, possible to register due to the Monaco jurisdiction.

  • 1. A limited liability company, at the head with two executive officers – natural persons only. The directors undertake to serve as the shareholders (one of them must be a resident of Monaco).
  • 2. A limited liability partnership. The citizens of any country are allowed to become the resident of such partnership.
  • 3. Unlimited liability Partnership. The terms of establishment are the same.
  • 4. A joint-stock company. It should comprise the shareholders with two types of responsibility.
  • 5. A private entrepreneur. A native of Monaco must be a resident.
  • 6. A branch of a foreign company/corporation at the head with the resident director only.
  • 7. Trust company. The residence of the founders within the jurisdiction of one year is essential.
  • 8. Representative office of a foreign company. A resident manager is required.
  • 9. Trust. This type is not a legal entity. Only a resident is allowed to act as a founder. The only option where confidentiality is almost brought to naught.

The registration process takes about three weeks. There are no strict requirements for naming, and they are minimized.

Regardless of the chosen language, the name should be written in Latin alphabet. However, its uniqueness is necessary. For certain types of activities, a special permission must be obtained to write it to the name.

Taxation
in “Principaute de Monaco”Company registration services
in Monaco

An important issue in the process of a companies establishment is income tax and other types of it. In this case, the Principality of Monaco provides a commercial activities tax, which is 33.5%. At the same time, the condition is met – deals outside the jurisdiction must come to at least 25% of the total corporation turnover.

Companies that receive 75% of the profits from financial transactions within the territory of Monaco are completely exempt from taxation.

As for a tax of 33.5%, there is one possibility that allows reducing the percentage to 10. Businessmen who maintain a small business in the jurisdiction, but receive large income outside it, can register most of it as wages.

Therefore, they exempt themselves from income taxes. However, this gap has already been noticed, and it is only a matter of time before it will be taken down.

Trusts are the most attractive form of doing business in Monaco. Their advantageous taxation system makes its establishment very profitable. In the trust creation process, you must pay a percentage of the total managed property value.

The number of beneficial owners directly influences the tax rate; it can be 1.3%, 1.5% and 1.7%. Also, the tax is reduced in the case of the trust managing that is located within Monaco. Futher, the annual tax will be 0.2% of the property value.

Types
of the registered organizations

Traditionally, the Anstalt organization is established in Liechtenstein by an authorized person who is appointed to conduct business in this state. The authorized person has the power to establish an organization on the basis of trust documents, on his own behalf, but in the client's interests.

After the “KYC” principle has been introduced, it is necessary to indicate the legal entity that has the authority to support the registration and further activities of the company.

General rules for the ANSTALT company
registration in LiechtensteinLinguistic cultureThe task (objective)An authorized capitalAn institutionBusiness ActivitiesSupreme Management BodyAdministrative AuthorityOfficialsBeneficiariesAccountingDeclarationThe time of a company registration DissolutionTax system and revenues

The name of the organization can be easily created in any language (it should be submitted in Latin letters). The name of the organization can be reserved. Special permission must be obtained if you want to use regional or international names of the states or places in the organization title in Liechtenstein.

The official language in the country is German. The translation of the Legislative Act on the formation of the organization in Liechtenstein from the German is filed on the first demand.

The task of the company in Liechtenstein is to carry out any types of the entrepreneurial activity not prohibited by the Liechtenstein legislation, for example, trade in products, services, Asset management, financing, property management, rentals, control over the assets of beneficiaries, funds.

Banking activities can be carried out by the banking institutions only; third party's assets may only be managed by licensed trustees. Foundations can only be engaged in non-commercial activities

According to the law, the authorized capital of an Anstalt company in Liechtenstein can be recorded in Swiss francs, euros and US dollars. The minimum authorized capital requirement is 30 000 CHF. The authorized capital can be formed in cash and in-kind.

Legal entities in Liechtenstein, as well as trust companies, are being established in accordance with the Articles of Association, that must be filed to the competent authorities. Companies in Liechtenstein can be established by one or more natural persons or a legal entity.

The only exception is a joint stock company, that requires at least two founders to incorporate. It is possible to establish a company by the Power of Attorney.

A Joint-stock company, a limited liability company, a trust company and a fund undertake to fulfill the obligation of the initial registration in the State Register (the Commercial company register).

Every legal entity, pased the registration process in Liechtenstein, as well as trust companies, require a supreme management body (a founders meeting, owner of the founder rights or another authority), that has the right to make decisions on behalf of the company.

At least one of the management board members (Board of directors, Board of trustees, Foundation council or Trustee) must have a registered office in Liechtenstein and must also have certain professional qualifications.

An administrative body in Liechtenstein, consisting of any number of natural or legal persons located in Liechtenstein or abroad, has the right to consolidate. The administrative authority is the executive body of the Liechtenstein organization.

The official representative, according to the regional database, is the official receiver and the connecting link with the authorities, for example, with the Tax administration and the State registration authority. The legislation does not provide the trust companies with the official representative.

The shareholders of the companies in Liechtenstein have the right for the company profits and property in the process of its activities, as well as for the remaining assets after dissolution.

In the case of a foundation, trust companies and partnerships, the beneficiaries who are entitled to income and / or assets are assigned by the founder, by the Charter, or by another authority.

The legislation requires all legal entities and trust companies to maintain their ledgers. Foundations and trust companies are legally exempt from this regulation.

The ledgers can be kept in any legal currency, including any freely convertible currency, as well as in English, French, Italian, Spanish or Portuguese.

The annual report, that, under certain circumstances, is required to be submitted to the Liechtenstein tax administration, with a translation into German.

Organizations, enterprises and registered foundations that do not carry out their commercial activities and their task, according to the charter, does not provide the implementation of such activities (therefore, only investment and asset management or the inclusion of participation shares, or other rights that, in fact, do not imply commercial activities) provide reports on the assets and liabilities every year.

For this reason, the Liechtenstein administrative authority must provide the official confirmation to the Department of the State Registration, that a report of the assets and liabilities is available and there was no commercial activity in the previous year (no statement of assets and liabilities should be submitted).

It takes no more than a week to register a company in Liechtenstein.

A legal entity, entered in the state register for dissolution, as well as the Trust Company, cannot be liquidated until six months after the convening of the third line of creditors. Deposit funds and trust companies can be legally expelled from the register within a few days. The main reason for deregistration, in all cases, is the decision of dissolution.

In the case of companies incorporated as limited liability companies / holding companies, income or asset gains are not subject to a capital gains tax or income tax in Liechtenstein.

A) The stamp duty or an organization fee must be paid after registration of a company in Liechtenstein.
During the establishing of a limited liability company, joint stock company, cooperative, the stamp duty is one percent if the capital amount exceeds CHF 1.000.000. The same fee should be paid for capital increases too.

A registration fee or a deposit fee is required to be paid after registration. The fee depends on the capital and legal form and should be paid after entering the state register, or submitting the incorporation documentation for preservation, as required by law. In the case of a limited liability company, fees must be added for the preparation of the statutory state documentation regarding the founding procedure, as well as the costs of the statutory announcements in the official press.

B) The following taxes should be paid after registration of a company in Liechtenstein, according to the relevant system:
A Corporate tax — A Capital gains tax. All legal entities, as well as trust companies and trust communities, must pay capital tax — one-tenth of a net assets percent, but not less than CHF 1000.00 – per year.
A Tax deduction at source — 4 per cent.
Taxation on securities.
In general, it is 0.15% for securities of Switzerland and Liechtenstein and 0.3% for securities of other countries. Liechtenstein banking institutions and brokers are generally responsible for payments, as well as others if they are involved in saling and purchasing of securities.
Value added taxation (VAT)
On January 1, 1995, the turnover tax (called WUST) was replaced by value added tax (VAT). Liechtenstein holding companies and local businesses are exempt from VAT if they have no turnover by the country.

Registration of a company Switzerland

Registration of a company in Switzerland

Registration of a company in Switzerland is a popular jurisdiction choice for several reasons. There are a very attractive tax system, loyal legislation even for non-residents, and a steady political and economic situation.

All these factors have made Switzerland extremely popular among the foreign businessmen seeking to establish their company in this region.

It is difficult to cooperate with the government authorities in a foreign country, without knowledge of the local language, legislation and percularities of the paperwork. Acalista group offers the services to everyone who have decided to register a company in Switzerland.

First, you need to figure out the purpose of a company establishment and choose the most optimal legal form of the organization. It is extremely difficult to do it without the experts advice and support.

Switzerland consists of 26 cantons. The legal entities organization in each canton are governed by a separate legislation. The Swiss tax system also has a complex structure.

Tax collection can be carried out at different levels: municipal, cantonal, federal, that determines the interest rate of the tax. The lowest taxes are charged in Zurich and Zug.

Swiss business rules
for non-residents

Since the registration of a company has done, it is necessary to arrange its activities. If the founder does not live in Switzerland constantly, it is necessary to supply the representation of the interests and legal support.

Forms of companies ownership
According to the Swiss law

Swiss law provides only two legal forms of organizations that can be registered on its territory.

  • A Limited Liability Company. At least one of the directors must be a Swiss citizen. Whilst the documents are filled for the state company registration, the founders must pay no less than 20,000 Swiss francs. Each year, a legal entity must submit the reports in the appropriate forms, provided by the legislation of a particular canton.
  • A Joint-stock company. The directors of the company are appointed by the founders, there are no specific requirements for their citizenship, but one of them must be a Swiss citizen. The amount of the joint stock company authorized capital is from 100,000 Swiss francs. Every year you need to submit an information about the accounting transactions, turnover of goods and income. In some cases, such a company is required to be audited annualy.

There are many legal responsibilities associated with the duties of director and management of a limited liability company.

Limited by shares

Most limited liability companies are “limited by shares”. It means that shareholders' liability for company financial obligations is limited by the value of shares they own but have not paid.

The directors of the company are not responsible for the company debts unless they have broken the law.

If you are a director of a limited liability company, you must:

  • Complete and submit a tax declaration every year
  • Pay tax and insurance through the PAYE system if the company pays your salary.

Your liability for company debts differs depending on the ownership of the commandite partnership and the limited partnership

In both types of companies, you can split a whole income between partners. Each partner pays tax on his profits share.

Responsibility for debts that cannot be paid during a limited partnership activities is shared between the partners.

"General" partners are personally responsible for the company's debts "

Limited partners are liable up only to the amount paid in the partnership capital.

General partners are also responsible for business management.

Partners in an LLP are not personally liable for the company's debts — their responsibility is limited by the amount of money they invest in the business.

The responsibilities and profit shares of the Partners are set out in the Partnership Agreement. “Appointed members” have additional responsibilities.

Each year, the partnership must send the partnership's Self Assessment — the tax return to HMRC.

  • To file a personal tax return every year
  • To pay income tax on their share of the partnership's profits
  • To pay for a national insurance

The partnership should also be registered with VAT if the profit is expected to be more than £ 83,000 per year.

Since Austria is a member of the EU, the Savings and Royalties EU Directive can be applied. It provides that, as long the parent company owns at least 10% of the subsidiary shares within the European Union for at least one year, there are no withholding tax levied on the payment of royalties to the Austrian company.

CORPORATE INCOME TAX (CIT): The standard rate is 25%. With the efficient tax planning and restructuring, the effective tax rate can be lower than 3-5%.

INCOMING DIVIDENDS: 0% overall for EU and countries with the tax treaties.

Capital Gains Tax (CGT): Companies are generally taxed at the standard corporate tax rate, although the reductions and exemptions are widely applied, as the result, an effective rate is 0%.

REPATRIATION TAX:

Royalty: 0% or reduced according to the tax treaty or the EU Directive. Otherwise, the tax rate is 20%.

DIVIDENDS: 0% or reduced for the dividends paid by an EU entity or treaty of jurisdiction. Otherwise, the tax rate is 25%.

INTEREST: As a general rule, no withholding tax is charged on interest.

VALUE ADDED TAX (VAT). EU VAT regime. The standard rate for the internal sales is 20%.

Registration of a company in Andorra

The specific feature of the Andorra legislation is the lack of possibility to buy a turnkey offshore company. It is not profitable and almost impossible. According to the laws of Andorra, the Articles of Association must describe the planned activities in the minute detail.

All future operations are accurately spelled out and submitted to the authorities.

This fact greatly distinguishes the country from other jurisdictions. In Andorra, it is impossible to start selling cars, and then hold a board of directors and switch to producing the computers under the same name of company. However, this country is great for a company registration.

Despite the strict legislation for anti money-laundering, Andorra provides a good climate for doing business. Low taxes also have a positive effect on the company development. It is also important that the taxes in Andorra are fixed, easily calculated and predicted. It makes work and financial reporting much easier.

The registration procedure is transparent, but requires learning the system. However, the Andorran laws impose a number of small requirements to the company. They are simple, but need some effort to fulfill them.

Implementation of the popular companies in Estonia
Limited Liability Company (OÜ) as a trading companyTaxation
of a company in EstoniaAbout country

Estonian limited liability company OÜ is appropriate for the commercial purposes. A special corporate tax system provides the tax payment in the case of the profit distribution only. There are no taxes for the accumulated retained earnings.

CORPORATE INCOME TAX (CIT): the tax refers to the actual profits distribution, mainly to the distributed dividends that have been distributed. The payable tax is 20/80 of the net income (20% of the turnover).

INCOMING DIVIDENDS: The 5% rate applies when dividends are paid to a company (other than a partnership) that holds at least 10% of the company payer's capital; otherwise, the rate is 10%. Estonia does not impose an income tax on dividends.

Capital gains tax (CGT): capital gains are considered as a regular income and are taxed by distribution.

Repatriation tax: since the Corporate Tax applies only to the distribution of profits, there is no separate withholding tax.

Bilateral tax treaties for the avoidance of double taxation BILATERAL 56 countries, including Malta and the UAE.

VALUE ADDED TAX (VAT). EU VAT regime. The standard rate for the internal sales is 20%.

The Estonian economy has rapidly grown in recent years, due to the liberal policies, implemented during accession to the EU. Estonia has been a member of the Eurozone since 2011. A special corporate tax system provides the payment of tax by limited liability companies only for the distribution of profits, i.e. the tax does not apply to accumulated retained earnings.

Bahrain
is an analogue of the UAE business market

Bahrain is a developing Arab state, focused on variety and diversification of business development. This country also attracts with stability, incentives for investment and a tax-free economic zone (no VAT).

ПThere are three main types of a company registration:

  • A With Limited Liability (WLL) Company – it is enough to have two founders and the same number of directors. The authorized fund is about 53 thousand US dollars (20 thousand Bahraini dinars BHD) and is paid at once. An audit is carried out annually.
  • A Joint Stock Company (BSC) – there must be at least two investors or shareholders, and at least three directors. The authorized capital is 250 thousand BND. 50% is paid before registration, the rest can be paid within three years. Reporting is submitted once a year, after an audit.
  • A Single Personal Company (SPC) – individual or private enterprise, therefore the director and owner are the same person. The authorized investment is 50 thousand BND. The report is submitted once a year, as with any other form of ownership.

Additional requirements for the registration of an offshore company:

  • The office must be located in the country;
  • A license is required for some types of business;
  • An income tax exemption (It does not apply to the gas and oil business)

Business conditions
in the Sultanate of Brunei

Brunei is an ideal place for business establishment and development: the state offers comfortable conditions for both local businessmen and non-resident investors. Moreover, the country's currency is reliable and stable.

There are four forms of business organizations in Brunei Darussalam, as well as in other countries. But there are some restrictions for the foreign investors. Therefore, a businessman from another country cannot conduct a private business in Brunei.

Other forms (partnership, open-type and closed-type joint stock companies, a branch of a foreign company) do not have such prohibitions. For the partnership establishment, non-residents of the Sultanate must obtain a special permition from the Department of Immigration, Economic Planning and Development, as well as from the Ministry of Labor.

All companies are required to submit financial statements regularly, but an audit is not necessary. At the same time, there is no currency control. The taxation system is well-to-do for the foreign investors. They should not pay:

  • a duty;
  • an income tax;
  • a corporate tax;
  • a stamp duty tax;
  • a capital gains tax.

However, a corporate income tax reaches 30%. But the resident companies pay tax on a whole income (received within and outside the country), and the foreign organizations – only on the profits earned within the jurisdiction.

The main terms of the international business registration in Brunei: a local registered office and resident agent, closed access to reporting (confidentiality of data), information about the form of organization in the name, prohibition on the share capital payment in local currency (Brunei dollar), a local cityzen secretary.

However, the director does not have to be a resident of the sultanate. Meetings can be held in any country. Another condition – the name of the organization should not contain the Cyrillic. Remarkably, the Brunei Darussalam authorities have signed an agreement with 12 countries to avoid double taxation.

The United Arab Emirates, and the emirate of Ras al-Khaimah as well, is not regulated by the EU and is not a member of the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD). It means that the country does not participate in the foreign automatic exchange of information.

Ras Al Khaimah (RAK) is located in the northern part of the UAE, bordering Oman. It is one of the seven emirates that formed the United Arab Emirates up.

The emirate covers the area of 1,684 square kilometers. Earlier it was known for the maritime shipbuilding and commercial activities, and now it is famous for the industrial sector.

The new legislation and regulations passed by the UAE authorities contributed the strong interest to the financial and investment sector in the RAK; as the result there are a lot of investment and business opportunities for individuals and companies around the world.

An International Business Company in RAK can do business internationally, own the real estate in the UAE, be used as a logistics company, maintain bank accounts, etc.

If the client's KYC documents (a copy of the passport and a proof of residence address, issued within the last 3 months) and a description of the proposed economic activity are received, and a verification is carried out by our legal department, we will register the company in the UAE — Ras Al Khaimah.

The RAK IBC are not allowed to do the commercial activities in the UAE. Any legal activity is permitted, except of the insurance, reinsurance, banking and investment activities on behalf of third parties.

The name of the company in the UAE — the RAK IBC should end with "Limited" or "Ltd". Prohibited names include: implying the government patronage, any connection with the financial sector, of any country or city, any name containing an abbreviation with no valid explanation, and any name that contains a registered trademark that is not owned by the company.

Other restrictions apply to the names that have already been registered or names that are similar to those that have been registered. In addition, it is prohibited to use names that are considered misleading, obscene or offensive.

Registration of a company in Georgia

Virtual zones in Georgia

Attracting of the investments is a great stimulus for the Georgian economy development. That was a reason for the adoption of the Virtual Zones Expanding Law in Georgia, that provides the tax exemptions for the companies involved in the computer technology. Such companies do not pay national taxes in the state.

Registration of a virtual enterprise
in Georgia

The main goal of the Georgian government is to create such conditions for doing business that would increase the investments and the development of the information technology sphere.

Due to the Virtual Zones Expanding Law, the tax incentives are provided to the companies, that develop the IT sector. Persons who have received a virtual status are exempted from national taxes paying. Moreover, they are exempt from paying a number of other taxes: income, value added, customs.

After the law adoption, it has become much easier to open an IT technology company in Georgia. There are no difficulties in the registration procedure and paying taxes. A person, who has received a virtual zone confirmation certificate, can carry out the company's activities without third party regulation.

Today, all legal entities, that want to start a business in this sphere, are not required to obtain a license. Simple registration procedure has attracted more foreign companies that want to deal with computer technologies in Georgia.

The aim of the law is to develop the computer technologies in the country and attract new investments. Now you can obtain the confirmation certificates of this status electronically. In order to get it, you need to contact the relevant authorities. Timeline for its receiving – during a weekday.

With a focus on an enacting the law, the Georgian government has made a number of amendments to the normative and legislative acts to comply with the adopted law. Also, the Tax Code has changes that relate to the preferential taxation of companies operating in the IT sector in Georgia.

The new law would contribute to the computer technology development. She also added that now in Georgia there are special virtual zones where companies are exempt from paying taxes.

But according to this law, the companies engaged in computer technology are exempt from taxation in the country.

It has become much easier and more profitable to start and conduct a business. It led to the rapid development of the information sphere.

Procedure of obtaining
a virtual zone person status

The activities of companies engaged in computer technology are governed by the adopted legislation and regulations.

The special attention in the Virtual Zones Law is paid to the order and procedure of obtaining a status that confirms the virtual zone person. In order to get this status, you need to contact a person authorized by the government. The status is assigned within 10 days after the request.

After that, the person, who received the status, needs to get an electronic certificate. It is issued within 48 hours after obtaining the status of a virtual zone person.

The legal entities that have received a certificate in electronic form can start doing business without a license and other documents. Persons who have been assigned the status of a virtual zone person must engage in the economic sphere that develop the information industry in the country.

Afret the Law takes effect, the tax is not imposed to:

  • the income, received from the supplies outside the administrative border of Georgia;
  • the supplies, that have been carried out abroad, including VAT;
  • the exportations that were carried as export payment from customs.

After the Law takes effect, the Georgian IT market began its rapid development. It became interesting for the foreign companies, who want to prevent the possible risks. They started making a software in Georgia, that eventually is not very expensive. The Law has made the favorable conditions for the business development in the IT sector.

A simple registration procedure contributes to a great interest for doing business in the computer technology sphere in Georgia. A willing can go through the procedure of getting an electronic certificate, that will be needed to conduct business in the IT sector. It is possible by visiting the online resource of the government of Georgia.

Registration of a company Canada

Registration of a company in Canada

Canada is a country with a quite strict taxation system. The ordinary Canadian companies income is taxed worldwide.

Thereby, they do not have the characteristics related to the tax or offshore structures, and are certainly prestigious.

However, the legislation of Canada offers the possibility of registering and using Canadian businesses with a zero tax rate. They are known as the LP companies.

The LP is a Limited Liability Partnership managed by at least 2 partners: a General Partner and others – Limited Partners.

If a Canadian LP with non-resident members does not conduct business and receive an income in Canada, it is not taxed in Canada, in fact it is equal to an offshore company

Canadian tax legislation does not treat LP as a separate subject of taxation. Founders ("Partners") must pay taxes on the income received by the LP company at their residence place, in proportion to their shares in LP, if this is provided by the legislation of that country.

Tax treaties
in Canada

The offshore LP companies are not considered to be residents for taxation in Canada and therefore are not eligible to use the Double Tax Treaties signed by Canada with other countries.

Registration of a company in Canada is a prestigious choice. Jurisdiction is not blacklisted by any countries and has no restrictions on cooperation with residents of any states.

Acalista group will register a Canadian LP company in accordance with the personal wishes.

The price of annual support services depends on the province of the partnership registration. The services will include an annual government fee, full payment to the registered agent / office), a General Power of Attorney for the current year.

Registration timeline – 2-3 weekdays, then legalization of the documents.

of a Canadian LP

Limited Partnership

In Canada, the LP partnerships should have at least 2 partners – individuals or legal entities from any jurisdiction. Information about partners is submitted to the Canada's Business Register where the partnership is established.

Canadian LP partners have shareholder status.

There are no compulsory requirements for a company secretary.

The minimum authorized capital in a Canadian LP is 1,000 CAD. There is no legal requirement for a full or partial payment of a capital for registration.

A company name of Canadian LP must end with the words “Limited Partnership” (LP). Company names containing words such as "Bank", "Insurance", "Trust", etc., are not permitted until the company obtaines the appropriate national license.

Information about an ultimate beneficial ownership must be disclosed to the registered agent and be kept confidentially by the agent.

Every Canadian LP should keep appropriate records and prepare the financial statements.

Companies with non-resident partners that do not conduct business in Canada, do not receive any income from sources in Canada, and that are managed and controlled outside Canada are exempt from federal and provincial sales taxes.
